translatedContent: v1 basato su [Phi 1.5 di Microsoft](https://huggingface.co/microsoft/phi-1_5)
v2 basato su llamaforcausallm
[Link Hugging Face](https://huggingface.co/haykgrigorian/TimeCapsuleLLM)
##  Comportamento del modello e limitazioni
I primi prompt mostrano che il modello risponde con linguaggio e comportamento degli anni 1800.

originContent: Early prompts show the model responding with 1800's language and behavior.
translatedContent: Esempio: Prompt: "Who art Henry?" e ha risposto "I know that man, I have did not a black, the storm."

originContent: Example: Prompt: "Who art Henry?" and it replied "I know that man, I have did not a black, the storm."

translatedContent: ![Esempio output TimeLockLLM](https://github.com/haykgrigo3/TimeCapsuleLLM/blob/main/london_1800_1850_v0/timelockllm_sample_output.png?raw=true)
- Nessun riferimento a concetti moderni
- Vocabolario prevalentemente accurato per l’epoca
- Frasi per lo più incoerenti (previsto per dati di addestramento di ~187MB)

originContent: - Sentences are mostly incoherent (expected for ~187MB training data)

translatedContent: Un miglioramento significativo rispetto alla v0.
- Stile vittoriano, punteggiatura corretta, frasi per lo più grammaticali

originContent: - Victorian writing style, proper punctuation, mostly grammatical sentences
translatedContent: - Tasso di allucinazione fattuale ancora elevato
- Rumore OCR (“Digitized by Google”) ancora presente negli output

originContent: - OCR noise (“Digitized by Google”) still present in outputs

translatedContent: ![Esempio output TimeLockLLM](https://github.com/haykgrigo3/TimeCapsuleLLM/blob/main/london_1800_1875_v0.5/fellowcitizens.png?raw=true)
Primo modello in grado di richiamare e collegare un reale evento storico a una figura effettiva del dataset.

originContent: First model to recall and connect a real historical event with an actual figure from the dataset.

translatedContent: Esempio: Prompt: "It was the year of our Lord 1834"

originContent: Example: Prompt: "It was the year of our Lord 1834"

translatedContent: Output: "It was the year of our Lord 1834 and the streets of London were filled with protest and petition. The cause, as many re counted, was not bound in the way of private, but having taken up the same day in the day of Lord Palmerston, the public will receive a short statement of the difficulties under which the day of law has reached us. It is a matter of deep regret, that the present events in the history of the world are clear, and consequently will be'known. It is not true that the very men who first settled in the Gospel at Jerusalem should have so extensive and so interesting a record of the prosperity and prosperity"

originContent: The output: "It was the year of our Lord 1834 and the streets of London were filled with protest and petition. The cause, as many re counted, was not bound in the way of private, but having taken up the same day in the day of Lord Palmerston, the public will receive a short statement of the difficulties under which the day of law has reached us. It is a matter of deep regret, that the present events in the history of the world are clear, and consequently will be'known. It is not true that the very men who first settled in the Gospel at Jerusalem should have so extensive and so interesting a record of the prosperity and prosperity"

translatedContent: Inizialmente pensavo che una protesta potesse essere avvenuta per coincidenza nello stesso anno, ma guarda qui: ![1834protest](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/haykgrigo3/TimeCapsuleLLM/main/1834protest.png)

originContent: At first I assumed that a protest might have coincidentally taken place the same year but take a look at this: ![1834protest](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/haykgrigo3/TimeCapsuleLLM/main/1834protest.png)

translatedContent: ### **v2mini-eval1**

originContent: Trained using a 15GB sample from v2's 90GB dataset.
translatedContent: Addestrato utilizzando un campione di 15GB dal dataset da 90GB della versione v2.
Modello addestrato solo fino a 10K step.

originContent: There was an issue with tokenization that causes output to look like this:
translatedContent: Si è verificato un problema con la tokenizzazione che fa apparire l'output in questo modo:
PROMPT:
Chi è Charles Dickens?
